args.query: mathlib4 GeneralLinearGroup GL n definition GeneralLinearGroup Mathlib4 'GeneralLinearGroup' 'GL'

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- The intersection of two subgroups of a group is again a subgroup. -/
theorem subgroup_intersection {α : Type _} [Group α] (G H : Subgroup α) : Subgroup α := by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry

/-- Special case for matrix groups: if G and H are subgroups of the units of n × n matrices
    (i.e., matrix groups / GL(n)), then their intersection is again a subgroup (a matrix group). -/
variable {R : Type _} [Semiring R] {n : Type _} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

theorem matrix_groups_intersection (G H : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R))) : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)) := by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-!
Simple statement: the intersection of two matrix groups (subgroups of the units of
n × n matrices) is again a subgroup.
-/

variable {R : Type _} {n : Type _} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] [Semiring R]

/-- If G and H are subgroups of the group of units of n × n matrices over R, then
their intersection is again a subgroup (a matrix group). -/
theorem matrix_groups_intersection (G H : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R))) :
    Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Intersection of two subgroups is a subgroup. -/
theorem subgroup_inter {α : Type _} [Group α] (G H : Subgroup α) : Subgroup α := by
  sorry

variable {R : Type _} [Semiring R] {n : Type _} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

/-- If G and H are matrix groups (subgroups of the units of n × n matrices), then
their intersection is again a matrix group. -/
theorem matrix_groups_intersection (G H : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R))) :
    Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-!
Let G, H be matrix groups (subgroups of the units of n × n matrices). Show that
there exists a subgroup whose underlying set is G ∩ H (i.e., the intersection is a matrix group).
-/

variable {R : Type _} [Semiring R] {n : Type _} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

theorem matrix_groups_intersection_exists (G H : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R))) :
    ∃ K : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)), (K : Set (Units (Matrix n n R))) = (G : Set (Units (Matrix n n R))) ∩ (H : Set (Units (Matrix n n R))) := by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry
